page.title: 08RELIGION
page.content: In the Langtree Parish we have got two chapels which are being converted into houses, one church, two other chapels and two Sunday schools. The Methodist Chapel have sevices and a Sunday School every Sunday morning. They have anniversary services during the year and a family service every month. The Minister is Rev.Breeze who lives at Stibb Cross. The last resident rector of Langtree, the Rev.Richard Wallington, retired in January 1985. The parish is now under the rector of Shebbear, the Rev.Nigel Mead, and services are held each Sunday. There is no Sunday School at present. There is a Mothers' Union attached to the Church.The present Church wardens are Messrs John Folland and George Heath.
